reviews.review_msg: Jim made this class really fun, despite the dry content. The assignments were very well designed. The notes had all the information needed for midterm & final exam. The tutorial assignments were great practice to prepare for the exams and ask any questions. Jim wanted all his students to do well and I highly recommend taking a class with him!
Fair midterm and exam, just need to know the materials in the slides. Notes are easy to follow.
Really unimpressed with the class. Dropped the course as soon as I realized he probably wouldn't get organized.
Intrested in material, simplifies lots of the material so everyone can understand but occasionally wanders on tangents (but you  don't need to know them) so overall good!

This is my second time taking a course with Miranda. She is very enthusiastic and caring, but she allows a cheat sheet during exams, which in Biology typically just adds a layer of complexity to the questions that means it is easier to do decently on the exams but harder to do excellently, as questions can't be simple ones like multiple choice

She likes to answer questions. Does not teach you how to answer questions on her exams. So much content and the exam is 7 questions from content of 8 lectures. No lecture recordings and you have to come to lecture for participation. Hated how the explanations she wanted on exams were never explained or taught in lectures.

Miranda is enthusiastic and clearly cares about her students and wants to support their learning. While lectures were very well-organized and clear, tutorials felt disjointed from the rest of the course and some activities were almost entirely pointless.

Miranda's course structure can be very difficult and her tutorial assignments were very difficult (worth 25%). Exams were fair, but the group project was a little too long (took the whole semester). Overall she was caring prof and the class did rather well.

Same as below. She's really nice & she encourages participation during lecture which is good practice. But tutorials can be hard bc she wants you to complete so many questions. Her notes are quite simple so it can be confusing & I'm not sure if those notes cover everything we need to know from the course. Exams are fair, wording is weird sometimes.

Miranda is super nice and caring but her lectures notes contains just the bare minimum so it can be difficult to study for exams. Also her grading tends to be based on certain keywords that she looks for so it can be difficult to get full marks on questions.
She's AWESOME. BEST PROF EVER

Horrible lecturer. She wasn't comfortable in front of the class, and the slides were not clear and too wordy. The quizzes were easy, but the final was not well organized, as it only covered random lectures that hadn't previously been quizzed.

She's the most easiest and nicest bio prof in SFU!! Her quizzes were always fair and straight forward. Serveral hours of study b4 the quizzes ensure u a decent grade. Final was relatively harder than the quizzes but she gave enoff hints b4 hand already. I've always been an average grade person n I got a B in this course~ I will take her again

I doubt Allison will set foot on this course for a long time, so I'll focus more about the technical stuff. Her exams were very easy and she even gave you hints on what materials to study. Presentations were essentially a freebie. Final exam was a bit tough, but fair. She gave some free answers to the questions before the final exam. LOL.
A very understanding teacher. She is approaching, able to think in students' perspectives, and give straightforward exams! One of the nicest profs ever!
Great, but he often cancels class. Very disorganized but hilarious.

Made Bisc366 a real joy. Super approachable, very friendly, clear grading criteria and interesting lectures. Relates material to real day stuff that's happening. Encourages questions. Powerpoints are clear and exams are based off of them. Gives advice on potential exam questions. Highly recommended!!

She is a great professor. You have to attend every lecture and take all the notes beside lecture notes because only 30% material is provided in lecture slide. The exam is easy if you memorize everything she gave you. And I got A- in this course.

PROS: - organized CONS: - reads off slides, not engaging - wordy but redundant notes, slow to main point - randomly selected exam questions; you will overstudy and understudy some topics - tutorial presentations mandatory but poor use of TA time - exam prep is weak: no practice exams ready, no post exam review sessions

Her slides make it really obvious what you should know for the exam, & she gives example exam questions. You need to show up because she uses the overhead for notes that go with the slides, & that info is also fair game on exams. Marking criteria is clearly listed, & she lets you hand in a draft of the project so she can help you not lose marks.
